title.narrative: Global Agriculture Food Security Program Private Sector Pilot

description.narrative: The Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP) is a World Bank-managed multi-donor mechanism which aims to improve incomes and food and nutrition security in low-income countries by boosting agricultural productivity. It was established in 2009 to assist in implementing pledges made by G20 Leaders in Pittsburgh to scale-up agricultural assistance in response to the 2008 global food price crisis. GAFSP provides funding through two separate channels – a Public Sector Window, which provides grant assistance to eligible governments for country-led programs; and the Private Sector Window (administered by the International Finance Corporation), which provides financing to agribusinesses, rural banks, micro-finance institutions and other private-sector participants. The total value of this investment is $10.2 million over 5 years, starting 2015-16.
